intro.title: Voluntary carbon credits — in plain words
intro.p1: A voluntary carbon credit represents 1 tonne of CO₂e either avoided (not emitted) or removed (taken out of the atmosphere) by a certified project. Companies and individuals buy credits to balance their own emissions.
facts: Two families: avoidance (e.g., clean cookstoves) and removals (e.g., reforestation).
We provide retirement certificates for your reporting.

quality.title: Quality & integrity checks
quality.intro: Quality credits are conservative, traceable and independently verified. Here’s what we look for:

verification.title: Verification & MRV
verification.body: Third-party auditors validate the project and monitor, report, and verify (MRV) emission reductions regularly.

additionality.title: Additionality
additionality.body: The climate impact wouldn’t happen without the project or its carbon finance.

doubleCounting.title: No double counting
doubleCounting.body: Robust registries prevent the same tonne from being claimed twice; project and national accounting are kept clear.

permanence.title: Permanence & leakage
permanence.body: Measures limit reversal risk (fire, logging) and avoid shifting emissions elsewhere; buffers or insurance may apply.

quality.typesBody: Nature-based (re/afforestation, mangroves), clean cookstoves, renewable energy in least-served regions, engineered removals (DAC/biomass), and more. We prioritize projects with strong co-benefits and recent vintages.
